availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Eckles (Green County, Kentucky, schoolteacher.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, schoolteacher. Virginia native. Married to Matilda E. Blankenship Eckles in Green County, Kentucky, in December 1823. Father of Mary Eckles, Susan F. Eckles, Martha F. Eckles, James J. Eckles, Francis M. Eckles, George W. Eckles, and John O. Eckles. Schoolteacher in Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Schoolteacher in Green County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, pp. 133A-B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Green County, District 2, p. 559.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hart County, Munfordville, p. 345B.
Kentucky, County Marriages, 1797-1954, Genealogical Society of Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT, Green County Marriages, Film 000592678.
